type.description: Service type determines how the service is exposed

targetPort.description: Target port on the pod (can be port number or named port)

nodePort.description: NodePort to expose on each node (only used when type is NodePort or LoadBalancer)

clusterIP.description: ClusterIP to be assigned to the service (use 'None' for headless service)

clusterIPs.description: List of IP addresses assigned to this service (for dual-stack)

externalIPs.description: List of external IPs for which nodes will accept traffic

loadBalancerIP.description: IP address of the load balancer (deprecated in favor of loadBalancerClass)

loadBalancerClass.description: Class of the load balancer implementation

loadBalancerSourceRanges.description: Restrict traffic through load balancer to specified client IPs

externalName.description: External reference that discovery mechanisms will return as an alias (only for type ExternalName)

externalTrafficPolicy.description: Denotes if this Service desires to route external traffic to node-local or cluster-wide endpoints

internalTrafficPolicy.description: Specifies if the cluster internal traffic should be routed to all endpoints or node-local endpoints only

timeoutSeconds.description: Timeout in seconds for ClientIP session affinity

publishNotReadyAddresses.description: Whether to publish addresses of not ready pods

ipFamilies.description: List of IP families (e.g. IPv4, IPv6) assigned to this service

ipFamilyPolicy.description: Represents the dual-stack-ness requested or required by this Service

allocateLoadBalancerNodePorts.description: Whether to automatically allocate NodePorts for LoadBalancer type services

annotations.description: Annotations to add to the service

labels.description: Labels to add to the service

ports.description: Additional ports to expose on the service
